subject: Web3
title: AML and Blockchain Analytics
description: A short lesson to help you apply AML and Blockchain Analytics.

hook.text: Chainalysis, Elliptic, and other firms track crypto transactions for governments. Blockchain is not as private as people think.

buildup.text: Every Bitcoin transaction is permanently recorded on a public ledger. Analytics firms map wallets to real identities.

discovery.text: The FBI used Chainalysis to trace the Colonial Pipeline ransomware payment and recover $2.3 million in Bitcoin.

twist.text: Privacy coins like Monero and mixing services make tracing harder. It's an ongoing arms race between privacy and surveillance.

climax.text: Blockchain analytics turned crypto's transparency into a law enforcement advantage. Public ledgers are evidence gold mines.

punchline.text: Every transaction recorded forever on a public ledger. It's the worst tool for crime.

quiz.question: How did blockchain analytics help in the Colonial Pipeline case?
options: They traced and helped recover $2.3 million in Bitcoin ransom
